A virtual reality experience where users can dance with famous choreographers from around the world. Users can don VR headsets and dance with professionals like Martha Graham, Fred Astaire, or Michael Jackson.

A social media platform that uses AI to analyze users' dance moves and provide personalized feedback and suggestions for improvement. Users can post videos of their dance moves and receive constructive criticism from a community of fellow dancers and choreographers.
A line of dance-themed clothing and accessories, including t-shirts, hats, and dance bags. Each item would feature a unique design inspired by a different dance style or culture.
A subscription box service that delivers a new dance-related item to customers each month. Items could include dance shoes, dance mats, or even a customized dance costume.

A mobile app that uses augmented reality to teach users how to dance. Users can choose from a variety of dance styles and the app will superimpose the dance moves onto their own bodies in real-time, allowing them to practice and perfect their technique.
